name: Dyottes.GitHub.io
body:
@@ -0,0 +1,130 @@

Randy Otteson

2700 Oak Ridge Trail Woodbury, MN 55125 (612) 308-3611 randyotteson@yahoo.com

Professional Summary

Computer Support Technician with fantastic User/Customer support skills. 15 years of computer support experience and I have not forgotten what it is like to be someone who doesn't have the experience on computers that I do. This comes in handy when dealing with the average user. When someone's computer stops working like it should, it is frustrating and stressful. I try to put a user at ease with humor, and by not talking over their heads in computer techno-babble.

Education

Alexandria Technical College (Alexandria, MN) - 1995-1997

  • Associates in Applied Science degree, Computer and Voice Networking, 1997

Century College (Maplewood, Mn),

  • Introduction to Networking, 04/18 - 06/08/2012
  • Introduction to PC Security, 04/18 - 06/08/2012
  • Advanced PC Security, 6/20 - 08/10/2012
  • Introduction to PC Troubleshooting, 10/17 - 12/7/2012
  • Wireless Networking, 10/17 - 12/7/2012

Certifications

  • Received certification from HP in desktop and laptop hardware repair. September 2007

Technical Skills

    Operating Systems

    • DOS, Windows 9x, NT, XP, Vista, 7, 8, 10

    Communication Software

    • Lotus Notes, MS Outlook, Office Communicator

    Support Software

    • Dameware (Remote Access), Peregrine, HP Service Desk, PowerQuest (Imaging software), HP Channel Services Network (Self Maintainer), PXE Network Imaging, Citrix Altiris Web deployment, Spybot Search and Destroy (Anti-Spyware).

    Securtiy Software

    • Norton AntiVirus, PointSec (Data Encryption)

    Time Tracking Software

    • Journyx, Timesite

Work Experience

Independent Contractor [10/2008 - Present]

UnitedHealth Group [8/1999-10/2008]

    Computer Support Technician/Desktop Support

    • Troubleshooting and fixing computer software issues onsite and remotely for sites across the country.
    • Troubleshooting and fixing onsite hardware issues.
    • Maintaining onsite "hot swap" and "loaner" inventories.
    • Setting up new computers for users.
    • Setting up workstations for new users.
    • Helped set up an maintain Work at Home/VPN project
    • Helped site move from a Windows NT /2000/95 mixture to all Windows XP.
    • Helped move to the "Image" system to standardize all computers at the site.
    • Developed and maintained computer "images" for the different needs of the different departments onsite.

Barr Engineering (Through Contracting Company) [8/1998-08/1999]

    Helpdesk Support

    • Trouble shooting software issues over the phone.
    • Typical call volume of 10-15 calls a day, about 10% of them I had to visit the desk personally or escalate it to Desktop Support.

Alternative Resources (Contract at UnitedHeath Group) [12/1997-8/1998]

    Computer Support Technician/Desktop Support

    • Troubleshooting and fixing computer software and hardware issues.
    • Responded to 15-20 calls or fix tickets a day.
    • Setting up new laptops or desktops for users.
    • Installing new all software.
    • Helped update entire site with new computers.

Minnesota State Colleges and Universities [6/1997-12/1997

    Computer Support (internship)

    • Troubleshooting and fixing computer software and hardware issues.
    • Responded to 10-20 calls or fix tickets a day.
    • Setting up new laptops or desktops for users.
    • Installing all new softwar.
